summary: An ordinance submitting to the qualified electors (voters) of the City at the special municipal election to be held therein on November 2, 1954 the proposition of creating an indebtedness in the sum of $4,600,000.00 and the issuance and sale therefor of general negotiable interest bearing serial coupon bonds of said City, for the purpose of constructing extensions, improvements and betterments to the municipal street lighting system and to pay the principal and interest on such bonds by an annual tax levy in excess of the millage limitation contained in Constitution Article VII, Section 2 and the state law during the term of such bonds; and required the City Clerk to certify to the Auditor of King County as required by law, the said proposition in the form of a specified ballot title; requesting the Auditor to call such an election; and declaring an emergency.
